##### 💛  - [Coveralls](https://coveralls.io)
@timchan1011  Does this pr complete?
Any idea to increase testing coverage?
Is it in version 4.0.0-RC2 or 3.1.0?
Can it reproduce on 4.0.0-RC2?
Duplicate with #2956.
Is it same issue with #3017?
Reflect is only in AbstractSpringJUnitTest.java for unit test to reload MetaData after create table.

We can discuss which sql should be check. In my view, we can divide the check into two parts, dataSource check and table check. In this PR table check for DML, and dataSource check for no master-slaver.
hi there, do you still work on this issue ?

this is my ddl sql ，with text column it occurs error
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31396902/64746849-c0741600-d53f-11e9-9c39-131a9db57dc7.png)

I have already pulled request this question, please pay attention to the latest example of the official website.
https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/cn/manual/sharding-jdbc/usage/sharding/

@betterjava 
how are things going on, do you need any help?
Hi @Myshiner , can you run 'npm install -X'  and show me the full debug logs ?
@Keanhua ，no need to install the Node  environment manually. We use the frontend-maven-plugin, and it can downloads/installs Node and NPM locally.
It's right to check all the DMLs. You can take a performance test for comparision.

@beckhampu thx, please refer to the 'npm install -X' logs, yup it seems permission problem, but i run with root.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48242833/64752295-9fb4bc00-d551-11e9-83fd-c7a165d61904.png)

@beckhampu it's ok now, i just adjusted the directory permissions.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48242833/64753443-d68cd100-d555-11e9-93e2-91ebc3749762.png)

but the maven build still hang of.
[INFO] Running 'npm install' in C:\documents\ShardingSphere\incubator-shardingsphere\sharding-ui\sharding-ui-frontend
@Myshiner , sorry , it's my fault !  Run 'mvn clean install -Dmaven.test.skip=true -Prelease -X ' , not 'npm install -X'.

@KomachiSion Is it necessary to check the `availableTargetName` of other strategies?
What do you think of creating an abstract strategy?

> @KomachiSion Is it necessary to check the `availableTargetName` of other strategies?
> What do you think of creating an abstract strategy?

it is no necessary to check `availableTargetName` in other strategies. Because other `ShardingStrategy` will call `ShardingAlgorithm` users implements, the `availableTargetName` will input to algorithm and users should return the route result according to the `availableTargetName `. What users return, what ShardingSphere will use.

Sorry @ningyu1,  is the problem your table algorithm don't know what datasource is?

For current route design, the datasource and the table algorithm is separated, they should calculate Independently. The algorithm is designed to get the route datasource or table only by the condition values. So your situation may cause route to more data nodes.

##### 💛  - [Coveralls](https://coveralls.io)
Hello, I don't think the checker will affect performance. Because it only check routingResult with shardingRule and meteData. and I don't know how to prove it. Please give me some advice.

You can compare the performance (QPS) between checking and without checking routingResult.
This work can be done by a performance tool like jmeter.

The ckecker do affect the performance. 
One query stay only several microsecond in ShardingSphere. Any additional operation, especially String operation (There's String + String in your codes), will affect the performance.
北京环球网校，http://www.hqwx.com/
OK, I will do this after mid-autumn festival.
